Gomez gained widespread recognition for her role as Alex Russo in the Disney Channel series "Wizards of Waverly Place," which aired from 2007 to 2012.

After her acting career, Gomez started a solo music career in 2011, releasing her self-titled debut album, "Selena Gomez," which included the hit single "Come & Get It." Gomez's pop and R&B music style has garnered her commercial success and numerous awards, including a Grammy Award for Best Latin Pop Album for her 2017 album, "Revelación."

Aside from her music and acting careers, Gomez has also used her platform to launch her own fashion brand, "Rare Beauty," in 2019. She is a philanthropist, actively supporting various charitable causes such as UNICEF and the Matilday Foundation. Throughout her career, Gomez has been vocal about her struggles with mental health, and in 2018, she stepped away from the entertainment industry for two years to focus on her well-being and launch Rare Beauty.

Today, Selena Gomez continues to inspire and entertain her millions of fans worldwide with her music, acting, and various philanthropic endeavors, while prioritizing her personal well-being and creative pursuits.
